id.description: A unique identifier of the catalog record.

created.description: Date of creation of this record.

updated.description: The most recent date on which the record was changed.

type.description: The nature or genre of the resource. The value should be a code, convenient for filtering records. Where available, a link to the canonical URI of the record type resource will be added to the 'links' property.

title.description: A human-readable name given to the resource.

description.description: A free-text account of the resource.

keywords.description: The topic or topics of the resource. Typically represented using free-form keywords, tags, key phrases, or classification codes.

language.description: The language used for textual values in this record representation.

languages.description: This list of languages in which this record is available.

resourceLanguages.description: The list of languages in which the resource described by this record is available.

externalIds.description: An identifier for the resource assigned by an external (to the catalog) entity.

scheme.description: A reference to an authority or identifier for a knowledge organization system from which the external identifier was obtained. It is recommended that the identifier be a resolvable URI.

themes.description: A knowledge organization system used to classify the resource.

formats.description: A list of available distributions of the resource.

contacts.description: A list of contacts qualified by their role(s) in association to the record or the resource described by the record.

rights.description: A statement that concerns all rights not addressed by the license such as a copyright statement.

item.title: STAC Item
item.description: This object represents the metadata for an item in a SpatioTemporal Asset Catalog.

collection.title: Collection ID
collection.description: The ID of the STAC Collection this Item references to.

resolution.description: Minimum time period resolvable in the dataset, as an ISO 8601 duration

ogc.api.records.v1.schemas.language.description: The language used for textual values in this record.

code.description: The language tag as per RFC-5646.

name.description: The untranslated name of of the language.

alternate.description: The name of the language in another well-understood language, usually English.

dir.description: The direction for text in this language. The default, `ltr` (left-to-right), represents the most common situation. However, care should be taken to set the value of `dir` appropriately if the language direction is not `ltr`. Other values supported are `rtl` (right-to-left), `ttb` (top-to-bottom), and `btt` (bottom-to-top).

concepts.description: One or more entity/concept identifiers from this knowledge system. it is recommended that a resolvable URI be used for each entity/concept identifier.

title.description: A human readable title for the concept.

description.description: A human readable description for the concept.

url.description: A URI providing further description of the concept.

scheme.description: An identifier for the knowledge organization system used to classify the resource.  It is recommended that the identifier be a resolvable URI.  The list of schemes used in a searchable catalog can be determined by inspecting the server's OpenAPI document or, if the server implements CQL2, by exposing a queryable (e.g. named `scheme`) and enumerating the list of schemes in the queryable's schema definition.

ogc.api.records.v1.schemas.contact.description:
Identification of, and means of communication with, person responsible
for the resource.

identifier.description: A value uniquely identifying a contact.

name.description: The name of the responsible person.

position.description: The name of the role or position of the responsible person taken from the organization's formal organizational hierarchy or chart.

logo.description: Graphic identifying a contact. The link relation should be `icon` and the media type should be an image media type.

phones.description: Telephone numbers at which contact can be made.

value.description: The value is the phone number itself.

roles.description: The type of phone number (e.g. home, work, fax, etc.).

emails.description: Email addresses at which contact can be made.

value.description: The value is the email number itself.

roles.description: The type of email (e.g. home, work, etc.).

addresses.description: Physical location at which contact can be made.

administrativeArea.description: State or province of the location.

country.description: Country of the physical address.  ISO 3166-1 is recommended.

roles.description: The type of address (e.g. office, home, etc.).

hoursOfService.description: Time period when the contact can be contacted.

contactInstructions.description:
Supplemental instructions on how or when to contact the
responsible party.

roles.description: The set of named duties, job functions and/or permissions associated with this contact. (e.g. developer, administrator, etc.).

ogc.api.records.v1.schemas.license.description: A legal document under which the resource is made available. If the resource is being made available under a common license then use an SPDX license id (https://spdx.org/licenses/). If the resource is being made available under multiple common licenses then use an SPDX license expression v2.3 string (https://spdx.github.io/spdx-spec/v2.3/SPDX-license-expressions/) If the resource is being made available under one or more licenses that haven't been assigned an SPDX identifier or one or more custom licenses then use a string value of 'other' and include one or more links (rel="license") in the `link` section of the record to the file(s) that contains the text of the license(s). There is also the case of a resource that is private or unpublished and is thus unlicensed; in this case do not register such a resource in the catalog in the first place since there is no point in making such a resource discoverable.

rel.description: The type or semantics of the relation.

type.description: A hint indicating what the media type of the result of dereferencing the link should be.

hreflang.description: A hint indicating what the language of the result of dereferencing the link should be.

title.description: Used to label the destination of a link such that it can be used as a human-readable identifier.

created.description: Date of creation of the resource pointed to by the link.

updated.description: Most recent date on which the resource pointed to by the link was changed.

uriTemplate.description: Supplies a resolvable URI to a remote resource (or resource fragment).

varBase.description: The base URI to which the variable name can be appended to retrieve the definition of the variable as a JSON Schema fragment.

variables.description: This object contains one key per substitution variable in the templated URL.  Each key defines the schema of one substitution variable using a JSON Schema fragment and can thus include things like the data type of the variable, enumerations, minimum values, maximum values, etc.

title.title: Item Title
title.description: A human-readable title describing the Item.

description.title: Item Description
description.description: Detailed multi-line description to fully explain the Item.

datetime.title: Date and Time
datetime.description: The searchable date/time of the assets, in UTC (Formatted in RFC 3339)

start_datetime.title: Start Date and Time
start_datetime.description: The searchable start date/time of the assets, in UTC (Formatted in RFC 3339)

end_datetime.title: End Date and Time
end_datetime.description: The searchable end date/time of the assets, in UTC (Formatted in RFC 3339)

ogc.api.records.v1.schemas.roles.description: The list of duties, job functions or permissions assigned by the system and associated with the context of this member.

title: Template Extension
description: STAC Template Extension for STAC Items and STAC Collections, using the base STAC schemas via building block references
